Frequently asked questions

Find out what temporary staffing means and who is the employer of record for a temporary worker. And more information about insurance and payment.

What does temporary staffing mean?

When you need to temporarily increase the size of your healthcare staff and expand your workforce, temporary medical staffing is the perfect solution! This can be a result of employee absences, census fluctuations, seasonal workloads and special projects. Depending on your facility’s need, a temporary assignment can last a day, a week, a month, several months, or perhaps even longer. It can also be the perfect solution to a particularly difficult shift you need to cover regularly. Signature NURSES Inc. works as your staffing partner to provide you with who you want, when you want them. Scheduling is our specialty and we work with you to take care of your residents and patients.

Who is the employer of record for a temporary worker? Do you carry insurance on Signature NURSES Inc. Employees?

We consider our temporary medical staff to be Signature NURSES Inc. Nurses employees. Since our nurses and aides are on the Signature NURSES Inc.’ payroll, Signature NURSES Inc. is the employer of record. We are responsible for paying all applicable payroll taxes and maintaining all applicable insurances such as worker’s compensation and professional liability.

When I call, will I talk with a recording or a live person?

Signature NURSES Inc. makes every attempt to be personally available 24/7 to our clients. However, because it sometimes seems as if every call comes in at exactly the same time, you might get a message asking you to leave a voice mail. We will return your call immediately and work quickly to take care of your staffing needs.

As a Signature NURSES Inc. employee, when do I get paid on a temporary assignment?

We provide weekly pay to our employees. You have the option of mailing, faxing, or emailing your timeslips, all paychecks are directly deposited to your account.

Do you have an employee referral program?

Yes. And we offer bonuses for referrals.

Do you provide any bonuses?

Yes. We provide employee of the month and year bonuses.

  • Registered Nurses
  • Licensed Vocational Nurses
  • Certified Medication Aides
  • Certified Nurses Aides

Temporary placements for one shift, one week or to fill your monthly schedules. Signature Nurses is available 24 hours a day to help you meet your last-minute needs.

To join our Signature Nurses network, all nurses and aide candidates must undergo a thorough quality assessment that includes:

  • Training review
  • License confirmation
  • Review of key competencies
  • Complete background check
  • Ongoing CPR, TB skin testing
